Entry requirements: 
•	Student at any of the universities of the ECIU;
•	B2 level of English language proficiency.
Applicants need to attach a copy of ID card / passport (document issued by the country of origin) to enrol in the KTU virtual learning environment. This does not apply to KTU students (if you are a KTU student, you may attach a blank page).
Students, who are admitted and accepted the offered place in the micro-module, will be informed by email on the steps to take in order to gain access to the KTU virtual learning environment. Students will receive an email from the teacher of the micro-module on the first day of the start of module.
Students who have dropped out from the KTU micro-module(s) in the autumn 2024 are not eligible to enrol in the KTU micro-module(s) in the spring 2025.

Description.En:
Have you ever found yourself wondering why working with other people sometimes is challenging?

This is because we are different, especially if we are from different cultures, each with its own traditions, clothing, habits, and language. In 2023, there were approximately 3.4 billion global employees, compared to 2.28 billion employees in 1991 - an increase of more than 1 billion people in 22 years. Therefore, intercultural communication and work in intercultural teams have become essential skills to be acquired due to globalisation and spreading internationalisation. Developing these skills becomes an advantage for a more successful start of a professional career.

In the micro-module “Intercultural Teamwork” we uncover the features of working together in teams with people from different cultures.

Everyone interested in teamwork and cultural differences is invited to join this course. You do not need to have any specific skills to participate.

At the end of the micro-module:

1. You will become acquainted with team-working phases and the intercultural differences that influence collaborative decision-making.
2. You will gain practical skills related to the principles of intercultural and virtual teamwork.

Are you ready to start this learning journey?

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
Everyone interested in teamwork and cultural differences is invited to join this course. No specific skills are required to participate. However, **active participation in teamwork is essential.** You will need to allocate time for synchronous meetings and collaborate offline with your colleagues from other countries to complete team tasks, develop your teamwork skills, achieve the goals of this micromodule, and successfully complete it .

Study format: Online, asynchronous course **with individually planned synchronous sessions with other team members.**

The learning journey will span 6 weeks, covering 6 topics. Resources include video lectures, reading materials, self-assessment tasks, assigned team and individual tasks, and discussions provided in Moodle.

Evaluation will be based on team assignments (50%), individual assignments (25%), discussions (15%), and a final quiz (10%).

[Syllabus of the micro-module](https://uais.cr.ktu.lt/ktuis/stp_report_ects.mdl_ml?p_kodas=MM00M117&p_year=2024&p_lang=EN&p_stp_id=)

The micro-module will be delivered in the KTU virtual learning environment. When a student is enrolled in KTU, s/he will be informed by email on how to gain access to the micro-module.  

After the successful completion of the micro-module:

In two weeks, a student will receive an email with the link to download the ECIU University micro-credential.

In mid-June 2025, a student from other university than KTU will receive an email with the KTU Transcript of Records that might be presented for recognition of learning outcomes at the home university.
Mastering Intercultural Teamwork: a Practical Virtual Course

The international mobility of people is an ongoing and expanding process. We increasingly encounter foreigners in our daily lives and at work. This module will cover the features of intercultural and virtual teamwork, phases of teamwork, cultural differences, and decision-making. It will help you improve your global citizenship and interpersonal competencies, making you more competitive in the labour market while working in teams with people from different cultures.
